worstByOverall.source: JUnitで単体テスト、Mockitoでモック作成、AssertJで流暢なアサーションを書きます。TestContainersで実際のDBを使った統合テスト、JaCoCoでカバレッジ測定します。
worstByOverall.reference: We will perform unit tests with JUnit, create mocks with Mockito, and write fluent assertions with AssertJ. We will perform integration tests using an actual DB with TestContainers, and measure covera
worstByOverall.output: We will quickly start mock unit tests in the J unit. We will write fluent assertions in J. We will measure coverage in integration tests using an actual DB with Testcontainers.

issues: Incorrectly combined unit testing and integration testing concepts

worstByOverall.source: RTO 1時間、RPO 15分の要件です。マルチリージョン構成で、Route 53のHealth Checkで自動フェイルオーバーします。データはCross-Region Replicationでリアルタイム同期します。
worstByOverall.reference: The requirements are RTO of 1 hour and RPO of 15 minutes. We will automatically failover with Route 53 Health Check in a multi-region configuration. We will synchronize data in real time with Cross-Re
worstByOverall.output: The requirement is an RPO of 15 minutes for 1 hour. We will perform automatic failover with Route 53 health checks in a multi-region configuration. Data is synchronized in real time with cross-region

issues: Mistranslation of RTO as a duration for RPO

worstByOverall.source: Cloudflare WorkersとDurable Objectsでエッジで状態を保持します。ユーザーに最も近いデータセンターで処理するので、レイテンシが1/10になりました。
worstByOverall.reference: We will persist state at the edge with Cloudflare Workers and Durable Objects. Because we process at the data center closest to the user, latency has decreased to 1/10.
worstByOverall.output: We will maintain state in H with Cloudflare Workers and Durable Objects. Because processing is done at the data center closest to the user, 0.4 became 1/10.

issues: Failure to convey the reduction in latency

worstByOverall.source: IssueにLabelで分類し、Milestoneでバージョン管理、Assigneeで担当明確化します。Issue TemplateでフォーマットUNIFY、ProjectsでKanban管理します。
worstByOverall.reference: We will classify Issues with Labels, manage versions with Milestones, and clarify responsibilities with Assignees. We will UNIFY formats with Issue Templates and manage Kanban with Projects.
worstByOverall.output: We will divide into labels in one cycle and manage versions with milestones. We will manage kanban in the format unified project with one-cycle templates.

worstByOverall.source: Semantic Versioningで v1.2.3 形式、Tagでリリースポイント記録、GitHub Releasesで変更履歴公開します。CHANGELOG.mdは自動生成します。
worstByOverall.reference: We will use Semantic Versioning with v1.2.3 format, record release points with Tags, and publish change histories with GitHub Releases. We will automatically generate CHANGELOG.md.
worstByOverall.output: We will record release points in semantic versioning in the V1 {2-3 format. We will publish the change history in GitHub Releases. changelog.md will be automatically generated.

issues: Corrupted version format (V1 {2-3 instead of v1.2.3)
Omission of 'Tags' as the mechanism for recording release points

worstByOverall.source: Spring Bootで DIコンテナによる依存性注入、JPAでO/Rマッピング、Spring Securityで JWT認証を実装します。@Transactionalでトランザクション境界を定義し、AOPで横断的関心事を分離します。
worstByOverall.reference: We will implement dependency injection using the DI container with Spring Boot, O/R mapping with JPA, and JWT authentication with Spring Security. We will define transaction boundaries with @Transacti
worstByOverall.output: We will implement JWT authentication with Spring Security for dependency injection by the DI container in Spring Boot. We will define transaction association with @Transactional and separate cross-cut

issues: Omission of JPA and O/R mapping
Incorrect logical connection between DI and JWT authentication

items.source: 今週の案件はAWSのVPC分割とセキュリティグループ再設計が中心です。JavaのAPIをECSへ載せ替えるので、移行手順と切替窓口を整理します。
items.reference: This week's scope focuses on AWS VPC segmentation and security group redesign. We are migrating the Java API to ECS, so we will organize the migration steps and cutover contacts.
items.output: This week's tasks will focus on AWS VPC segmentation and security group redesign. We will organize the migration procedure and switchover contact point, since we will be migrating the Java API to ECS.

items.source: TypeScriptのフロントはBFF強化の方針で、GraphQLのスキーマ設計をレビュー中です。UnitTestはJest、E2EはPlaywrightで回し、CIはGitHub Actionsで統一します。
items.reference: For the TypeScript frontend, we plan to strengthen the BFF and are reviewing the GraphQL schema. Unit tests use Jest, E2E uses Playwright, and CI is unified on GitHub Actions.
items.output: The TypeScript frontend is under BFF plan to strengthen and we are reviewing the GraphQL schema design. We will run unit tests with Jest and E2E with Playwright, and unify them with GitHub Actions.

issues: Awkward phrasing: 'under BFF plan to strengthen'
Ambiguous 'them' in the final clause (refers to CI, not tests)

items.source: OCI側のログ監視が弱いので、Cloud GuardとLoggingを組み合わせて検知基盤を作ります。運用チーム向けにRunbookも整備しておきます。
items.reference: OCI log monitoring is weak, so we will combine Cloud Guard and Logging to build a detection platform. We will also prepare a runbook for the operations team.
items.output: Since log monitoring on the OCI side is weak, we will create an architecture version that combines Cloud Guard and Logging. We will also prepare a runbook for the operations team.

issues: Slightly awkward phrasing in the first sentence

items.source: Spring BootのバッチをLambdaに分割する案はコストは下がりますが、スロットリングが心配です。Step Functionsで再試行と監査ログを入れる方向で調整しています。
items.reference: Splitting the Spring Boot batch into Lambda reduces cost, but throttling is a concern. We are adjusting the plan to use Step Functions with retries and audit logs.
items.output: The plan to split the Spring Boot batch into Lambda will reduce costs, but we are concerned about throttling. We are adjusting the direction to include retries and audit logs with Step Functions.

items.source: OpenAIとAnthropicのAPIを切り替えられる抽象レイヤーを作ります。プロンプトは業務部門が触れるので、テンプレ化とバージョン管理が必須です。
items.reference: We will build an abstraction layer to switch between OpenAI and Anthropic APIs. Because business teams will edit prompts, templates and versioning are required.
items.output: We will create an abstraction layer that allows switching between the OpenAI and Anthropic APIs. Because prompts are edited by business teams, templates and versioning are required.

items.source: 既存のJavaモノリスを段階的にマイクロサービス化します。まず認証と請求を切り出し、API Gatewayでルーティングします。加えて、移行後のSLAと監視指標を定義して運用手順に落とします。
items.reference: We will gradually microservice the existing Java monolith. First we will carve out authentication and billing and route via API Gateway. We will also define SLAs and monitoring metrics for operations.
items.output: We will gradually convert the existing Java monolith to microservices. First, we will extract authentication and billing, and route them with the API Gateway. In addition, we will define SLAs and moni

items.source: TerraformでAWSとOCIの二重管理を行いますが、状態ファイルの分離と権限の最小化が重要です。監査ログも統一形式にします。
items.reference: We will manage AWS and OCI with Terraform, but separating state files and minimizing permissions are critical. Audit logs will be standardized as well.
items.output: We will manage both AWS and OCI with Terraform, but separation of state files and minimization of permissions are critical. We will also standardize audit logs.

items.source: CIのジョブ時間が長いので、TypeScriptのビルドをキャッシュし、UnitTestとE2Eを並列に回します。失敗時はSlackに自動通知します。
items.reference: CI jobs are taking too long, so we will cache the TypeScript build and run UnitTest and E2E in parallel. Failures will notify Slack automatically.
items.output: Since the CI job time is long, we will cache the TypeScript build and run the UnitTest and E2E in parallel. In case of failure, we will automatically notify Slack.

items.source: 今期はゼロトラストを意識して、OIDCと短期クレデンシャルを使ったデプロイに切り替えます。GitHub ActionsからAWSへロール連携します。
items.reference: This quarter we will emphasize zero trust and switch deployments to OIDC with short-lived credentials. We will federate roles from GitHub Actions to AWS.
items.output: This term, we will switch to deployments using OOIDC and short-term credentials, being mindful of zero trust. We will perform role federation from GitHub Actions to AWS.

items.source: Javaの例外設計を見直し、業務コードとシステムコードを分離します。ログはJSON化してAthenaで検索しやすくします。エラーコード表と再試行ポリシーも整理してチームで共有します。
items.reference: We will review Java exception design and separate business and system codes. Logs will be JSON to improve Athena search. We will also organize error codes and retry policies for the team.
items.output: We will review the Java exception design and separate business code from system code. We will convert logs to JSON format to make them easier to search with Athena. We will also organize the error cod

items.source: CloudWatchでメトリクス監視、CloudWatch Logsで集約、X-Rayで分散トレーシングします。アラートはSNS経由でSlackに通知、重要度に応じてPagerDutyでエスカレーションします。
items.reference: We will perform metrics monitoring with CloudWatch, aggregation with CloudWatch Logs, and distributed tracing with X-Ray. We will notify alerts to Slack via SNS, and escalate with PagerDuty according
items.output: We will monitor metrics with CloudWatch, and perform distributed tracing at the aggregation layer with CloudWatch Logs. Alerts will be notified to Slack via SNS, and escalated via PagerDuty according

issues: Mistranslation: CloudWatch Logs is for log aggregation, not distributed tracing
Omission: The role of X-Ray for distributed tracing is missing
Technical inaccuracy: Conflated CloudWatch Logs with the tracing layer

items.source: TerraformでIaCを実装しました。AWS CDKも検討しましたが、マルチクラウド対応を優先してTerraformにしました。Stateファイルはリモートバックエンドで管理します。
items.reference: We implemented IaC with Terraform. We also considered AWS CDK, but prioritized multi-cloud support and chose Terraform. We will manage State files with a remote backend.
items.output: We implemented IAC with Terraform. We also considered AWSCDK, but we prioritized multi-cloud support and chose Terraform. We will manage the state files with a remote backend.

items.source: WAFでSQLインジェクション対策、IAMでロール制御、Security Groupでネットワーク制限します。Secrets Managerで認証情報を暗号化し、KMSで鍵管理します。
items.reference: We will implement SQL injection countermeasures with WAF, role control with IAM, and network restrictions with Security Group. We will encrypt credentials with Secrets Manager and manage keys with KMS
items.output: We will implement SQL countermeasures with wafu, control roles with IAM, and restrict networks by group. We will encrypt credentials with Secret Manager and manage keys with KMS.

items.source: Reserved InstanceとSavings Planで40%コスト削減しました。不要なS3オブジェクトはGlacierに移行、CloudFrontのキャッシュヒット率を上げて Origin 負荷を減らしました。
items.reference: We achieved a 40% cost reduction with Reserved Instances and Savings Plans. We migrated unnecessary S3 objects to Glacier, and reduced Origin load by increasing the CloudFront cache hit ratio.
items.output: We reduced costs by 40% with Reserved Instances and Savings Plans. We migrated unnecessary S3 objects to Glacier. We increased the CloudFront cache hit ratio to reduce origin load.

items.source: RTO 1時間、RPO 15分の要件です。マルチリージョン構成で、Route 53のHealth Checkで自動フェイルオーバーします。データはCross-Region Replicationでリアルタイム同期します。
items.reference: The requirements are RTO of 1 hour and RPO of 15 minutes. We will automatically failover with Route 53 Health Check in a multi-region configuration. We will synchronize data in real time with Cross-Re
items.output: The requirement is an RPO of 15 minutes for 1 hour. We will perform automatic failover with Route 53 health checks in a multi-region configuration. Data is synchronized in real time with cross-region

issues: Mistranslation of RTO as a duration for RPO

items.source: Cloudflare WorkersとDurable Objectsでエッジで状態を保持します。ユーザーに最も近いデータセンターで処理するので、レイテンシが1/10になりました。
items.reference: We will persist state at the edge with Cloudflare Workers and Durable Objects. Because we process at the data center closest to the user, latency has decreased to 1/10.
items.output: We will maintain state in H with Cloudflare Workers and Durable Objects. Because processing is done at the data center closest to the user, 0.4 became 1/10.

issues: Failure to convey the reduction in latency

items.source: Git Flowを導入します。mainが本番、developが統合、feature/*で機能開発、hotfix/*で緊急修正します。PRは必須で、Approveが2名必要です。Squash Mergeで履歴を綺麗に保ちます。
items.reference: We will introduce Git Flow. main is for production, develop is for integration, feature/* is for feature development, and hotfix/* is for emergency fixes. Pull Requests are mandatory, and 2 Approves a
items.output: We will introduce Gitflow. Production level drops are integrated. Feature development is done with feature/ and emergency fixes are done with hotfix/. PRs are required and 2 approvals are necessary. W

issues: Vague phrasing 'Production level drops are integrated'
Missing wildcard asterisks in branch naming patterns

items.source: Draft PRで早期共有し、Code Reviewで品質チェック、Status Checkで CI通過を必須にします。Merge Conflictはrebase方式で解決し、CODEOWNERSで自動レビュアー指定します。
items.reference: We will share early with Draft PRs, perform quality checks with Code Review, and require CI passing with Status Check. We will resolve Merge Conflicts with the rebase method, and automatically assign
items.output: We will share early with draft PRs, and we will require CI passage with quality check status checks in code reviews. We will resolve merge conflicts using the rebase method, and we will automatically

issues: Conflated 'Code Review' and 'Status Check' into a single confusing phrase
Loss of distinction between quality checks and CI requirements

items.source: GitHub ActionsでCI/CDを構築しました。WorkflowはPush Triggerで起動、Jobは並列実行、Cacheで依存関係を高速化します。Secretで認証情報を管理し、Environmentで本番デプロイを保護します。
items.reference: We have built CI/CD with GitHub Actions. Workflows are triggered by Push Trigger, Jobs are executed in parallel, and dependencies are accelerated with Cache. We manage credentials with Secret, and pro
items.output: We have built CICD with GitHub Actions. The workflow is triggered by a push trigger. Jobs are executed in parallel. We will constrain dependencies with caching. We will manage credentials with secrets

issues: Inconsistent use of future tense ('will') compared to source context

items.source: IssueにLabelで分類し、Milestoneでバージョン管理、Assigneeで担当明確化します。Issue TemplateでフォーマットUNIFY、ProjectsでKanban管理します。
items.reference: We will classify Issues with Labels, manage versions with Milestones, and clarify responsibilities with Assignees. We will UNIFY formats with Issue Templates and manage Kanban with Projects.
items.output: We will divide into labels in one cycle and manage versions with milestones. We will manage kanban in the format unified project with one-cycle templates.

items.source: EKSのノードグループをスポット併用にしてコストを下げますが、Podの再配置に備えてHPAの設定を強化します。PDBとスケジュール分散も見直します。
items.reference: We will use spot instances in EKS node groups to cut costs, but strengthen HPA settings to handle pod relocation. We will also review PDBs and scheduling spread.
items.output: We will reduce costs by using spot instances for the EKS node group, but we will strengthen the HPA settings in preparation for pod reallocation. We will also review PDB and scheduling distribution.

issues: Minor: 'scheduling distribution' is less standard than 'scheduling spread' in K8s context

items.source: Branch ProtectionでmainへのDirect Push禁止、Required Reviewsで2名承認必須、Dependabotで脆弱性自動検出、Secret Scanningで認証情報漏洩防止します。
items.reference: We will prohibit Direct Push to main with Branch Protection, require approval by two people with Required Reviews, automatically detect vulnerabilities with Dependabot, and prevent credential leaks wi
items.output: We will prohibit direct pushes to main with branch protection, and require approval from 2 people in required reviews. We will automatically detect vulnerabilities with Dependabot, and prevent credent

items.source: Conventional Commitsを採用します。feat/fix/docs/refactorで種別を明確化、otak-committerで自動生成します。Amendで直前コミット修正、Cherry-pickで特定コミット適用します。
items.reference: We will adopt Conventional Commits. We will clarify types with feat/fix/docs/refactor, and automatically generate them with otak-committer. We will amend the immediately preceding commit with Amend, a
items.output: We will adopt Conventional Commits. We will automatically generate with type clarification committers for feat/fix/docs/refactor. We will amend to correct the immediately preceding commit. We will che

issues: Omission of the specific tool name 'otak-committer'
Slightly awkward phrasing regarding 'type clarification committers'

items.source: モノレポ戦略でコンテキスト共有を最大化します。Submoduleではなく、単一リポジトリで全サービスを管理し、GitHub MCPでAI連携します。
items.reference: We will maximize context sharing with a monorepo strategy. We will manage all services in a single repository instead of Submodule, and we will integrate with AI using GitHub MCP.
items.output: We will maximize context sharing with a monorepo strategy. We will manage all services in a single repository instead of submodules, and we will integrate AI with GitHubMCP.

items.source: Semantic Versioningで v1.2.3 形式、Tagでリリースポイント記録、GitHub Releasesで変更履歴公開します。CHANGELOG.mdは自動生成します。
items.reference: We will use Semantic Versioning with v1.2.3 format, record release points with Tags, and publish change histories with GitHub Releases. We will automatically generate CHANGELOG.md.
items.output: We will record release points in semantic versioning in the V1 {2-3 format. We will publish the change history in GitHub Releases. changelog.md will be automatically generated.

issues: Corrupted version format (V1 {2-3 instead of v1.2.3)
Omission of 'Tags' as the mechanism for recording release points

items.source: Peer Reviewは同僚が実施、Approve後にMerge可能、Request Changesで修正要求します。Commentで質問や提案を記録し、Resolve Conversationで解決確認します。
items.reference: Peer Reviews are performed by colleagues, and merging is possible after approval, with Request Changes used to request modifications. We will record questions and suggestions in Comments, and we will
items.output: Peer reviews are performed by colleagues, and merging is possible after approval. We will request corrections with Best Change. We will record questions and suggestions in comments, and confirm resolu

items.source: Git Rebaseで履歴を整理、Squashで無駄なコミットを統合、Force Pushで履歴を書き換えます。Stashで一時退避し、Cherry-pickで必要な変更だけ適用します。
items.reference: We will organize histories with Git Rebase, integrate unnecessary commits with Squash, and rewrite histories with Force Push. We will temporarily save with Stash, and apply only necessary changes with
items.output: We will organize the history on a git-tori basis. We will integrate unnecessary commits with squash. We will rewrite the history with force push. We will temporarily save with stash and apply only the

issues: Technical term error in first sentence
Meaning of the first clause is corrupted

items.source: Spring Bootで DIコンテナによる依存性注入、JPAでO/Rマッピング、Spring Securityで JWT認証を実装します。@Transactionalでトランザクション境界を定義し、AOPで横断的関心事を分離します。
items.reference: We will implement dependency injection using the DI container with Spring Boot, O/R mapping with JPA, and JWT authentication with Spring Security. We will define transaction boundaries with @Transacti
items.output: We will implement JWT authentication with Spring Security for dependency injection by the DI container in Spring Boot. We will define transaction association with @Transactional and separate cross-cut

issues: Omission of JPA and O/R mapping
Incorrect logical connection between DI and JWT authentication

items.source: @Componentでコンポーネント登録、@Serviceでサービス層、@Repositoryでデータアクセス層を定義します。@Autowiredで依存性注入し、ApplicationContextでBean管理します。
items.reference: We will define components with @Component, service layers with @Service, and data access layers with @Repository. We will inject dependencies with @Autowired, and manage Beans with ApplicationContext.
items.output: We will register components with @Component. We will present the service layer with service. We will inject dependencies with @Autowired and manage personnel with the application context.

issues: Incorrect terminology for service layer definition

items.source: Mavenで依存管理します。pom.xmlで spring-boot-starter-web、spring-boot-starter-data-jpa、lombokを定義します。Maven Centralからアーティファクトをダウンロードし、Fat JARでビルドします。
items.reference: We will manage dependencies with Maven. We will define spring-boot-starter-web, spring-boot-starter-data-jpa, and lombok in pom.xml. We will download artifacts from Maven Central and build with Fat JA
items.output: In Maybe, we will define spring-boot-starter-web, spring-boot-starter-data-JPA, and Lombok in the dependency management pom.xml. We will download artifacts from Maven Central and build with a fat jar.

issues: Omission of the explicit statement regarding dependency management via Maven

items.source: JPAでEntity定義、@Idで主キー、@GeneratedValueで自動採番します。Repositoryインターフェースを継承し、カスタムクエリは@Queryで実装します。Hibernateが実装です。
items.reference: We will define Entity with JPA, use @Id for primary keys, and use @GeneratedValue for auto-numbering. We will inherit the Repository interface, and implement custom queries with @Query. Hibernate is t
items.output: We will automatically judge entity definitions in JPA with @ and primary GeneratedValue. We will inherit the repository interface and implement custom queries with @query. Hibernate is the implementat

issues: Incorrect syntax/logic for primary key definition

items.source: 基幹システム連携のためにSQSを挟み、遅延吸収をします。メッセージの冪等性を保証するために重複検知キーを入れます。障害時はDLQに退避し、手動再送の手順を作ります。
items.reference: For core system integration we insert SQS to absorb latency. To ensure idempotency we will add a deduplication key. On failure we will send to DLQ and prepare a manual replay procedure.
items.output: We will use SQS to absorb delays for system interoperation. We will include a deduplication key to guarantee message idempotency. In the event of a failure, we will evacuate to a DLQ and create a manu

items.source: JUnitで単体テスト、Mockitoでモック作成、AssertJで流暢なアサーションを書きます。TestContainersで実際のDBを使った統合テスト、JaCoCoでカバレッジ測定します。
items.reference: We will perform unit tests with JUnit, create mocks with Mockito, and write fluent assertions with AssertJ. We will perform integration tests using an actual DB with TestContainers, and measure covera
items.output: We will quickly start mock unit tests in the J unit. We will write fluent assertions in J. We will measure coverage in integration tests using an actual DB with Testcontainers.

issues: Incorrectly combined unit testing and integration testing concepts

items.source: Gradleに移行しました。build.gradleでKotlin DSL、マルチモジュール構成で共通ライブラリを分離、ビルドキャッシュで高速化しました。Mavenより2倍速いです。
items.reference: We have migrated to Gradle. We will use Kotlin DSL in build.gradle, separate common libraries in a multi-module configuration, and accelerate with build cache. It is twice as fast as Maven.
items.output: The grade has been migrated. We have separated the common libraries in a multi-module configuration and sped it up with a build cache. It is twice as fast as the nominal time.

items.source: JVMのGCをG1GCからZGCに変更しました。Stop-The-Worldが1ms以下になり、レスポンスタイムが安定しました。JITコンパイラのウォームアップも最適化しています。
items.reference: We changed the JVM GC from G1GC to ZGC. Stop-The-World is now 1ms or less, and response times are stable. We are also optimizing the JIT compiler warm-up.
items.output: We changed the GC of the JVM from G1GC to ZGC. Stop-the-world pauses are now 1ms or less, and response times are stable. We are also optimizing the warm-up of the JIT compiler.

items.source: Java 21のVirtual Threadsを導入しました。軽量スレッドで同時接続数が10倍になり、リソース消費は1/10です。Pattern MatchingでSwitch式も簡潔になりました。
items.reference: We have introduced Virtual Threads in Java 21. Concurrent connections have increased tenfold with lightweight threads, and resource consumption is 1/10. Switch expressions have also become simpler wit
items.output: We have introduced virtual threads in Java21. The number of concurrent connections will increase tenfold with lightweight threads, and resource consumption will be 1/10. Switch expressions will also b

issues: Incorrect use of future tense for features already introduced

items.source: Spring Cloud Gatewayで APIゲートウェイ、Eurekaでサービスディスカバリ、Resilience4jでサーキットブレーカーを実装します。Config Serverで設定を集中管理します。
items.reference: We will implement an API gateway with Spring Cloud Gateway, service discovery with Eureka, and a circuit breaker with Resilience4j. We will centrally manage configurations with Config Server.
items.output: We will implement a circuit breaker with Resilience4J in the API gateway ghost in Spring Cloud Gateway for service discovery. We will centrally manage configurations with Config Server.

issues: Incorrect mapping of technologies to functions

items.source: SonarQubeでコード品質分析、PMDで静的解析、Checkstyleでコーディング規約チェック、SpotBugsでバグ検出します。品質ゲートで基準未達はマージ不可です。
items.reference: We will perform code quality analysis with SonarQube, static analysis with PMD, coding rule checks with Checkstyle, and bug detection with SpotBugs. Merging is not possible if the quality gate criteri
items.output: We will perform code quality analysis with SonarQube using static analysis style and detect bugs with coding rule checks and bugs. The criteria for meeting the quality gate is the merge load.

issues: Mistranslation of tool functions (PMD, Checkstyle, SpotBugs are conflated)
Nonsensical translation of 'merge impossible' as 'merge load'

items.source: TypeScriptのstrictモードで型安全性を最大化します。Type AnnotationでString、Interface定義でオブジェクト構造、Genericsで再利用性、Utility TypesでPartial/Pick活用します。
items.reference: We will maximize type safety in TypeScript's strict mode. We will use String in Type Annotation, object structures in Interface definitions, reusability in Generics, and Partial/Pick in Utility Types.
items.output: We will maximize type safety in TypeScript's strict mode. We will leverage partial pick with string interface definitions in type annotations, object structure generics, and reusable utility types.

issues: Mistranslation of technical relationships (e.g., 'partial pick with string interface')
Incorrect mapping of Generics to object structures
Severe semantic distortion of the original technical requirements

items.source: Promise、async/awaitで非同期処理を実装します。Event Loopの仕組みを理解し、Callbackではなく async/await で可読性を向上させました。Error HandlingもTry-Catchで統一します。
items.reference: We will implement asynchronous processing with Promise and async/await. We understand the mechanism of the Event Loop, and improved readability with async/await instead of Callback. We will also unify
items.output: We will implement asynchronous processing with Promises and async/await. We understood the mechanism of the event loop and improved maintainability with async/await instead of callbacks. We will also
